message_1: In a group of 8 people, how many different ways can they form a circle for a game of "pass the parcel"?
message_2:
When arranging people in a circle, we consider one arrangement to be the same as another if it can be obtained by a rotation. So, we have to divide by the number of people to account for the rotations that give the same arrangement.

There are 8 people, so there are 8! (8 factorial) ways to arrange them in a line. To account for the rotations, we divide by 8:

Number of ways to arrange in a circle = (8!)/8 = (8 × 7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1)/8

The 8 in the numerator and denominator cancel out:

Number of ways = 7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1 = 7! = 5,040

So, there are 5,040 different ways to arrange the 8 people in a circle for the game of "pass the parcel."
